Title: the platonic permutation

Raj: Have you guys seen this feature that lets you talk to Siri without pressing any buttons?
You just say, uh, Hey, Siri, what time is it?
Nice try. It only recognizes my voice.
Do you ever do anything for anyone else?
You’re in a soup kitchen, not a production of Oliver!
You know, this reminds me of high school.
No, I was in India, it was humid and smelled funny.
You know, I read that washing dishes can be an excellent form of meditation. The key is that while washing the dishes one should only be washing the dishes.

No, seriously. It’s about being present in the moment, focusing on the feeling of the warm water, the smell of the detergent, the sound of the dishes squeaking, and following your own breath. It’s about, it’s about simply being.
Howard: No. How does it work?
So now anyone can control your phone? Hey, Siri, show me pictures of naked grandma butts.
Oh. Cool. (In thick Indian accent) Hey, Siri, show me pictures of naked grandma butts.
Oh, I can’t. I’m going to the soup kitchen, too.
If you can’t support me when I’m lying, why are we married?
Six hours? Oh, God, I don’t want to complain for that long.
I happen to be a giving and generous lover.
Maybe I’m happy that so many people turned up to help the less fortunate.
Wipe that smug smile off your face.
So we don’t even get to be up front where the action is?
I don’t know. I was hoping some poor kid would come up to me and say, please, sir, I want some more.
It’s not like I’m expecting them to sing.
All right, I think I’m getting into a groove here. This isn’t so bad.
We’ve only been doing this 20 minutes?
Just because you have that accent doesn’t mean what you say isn’t stupid.
Huh. Okay, I’ll try it.
No fair, I was meditating.
Thanks. You got to be kidding me.
Y, you’re Elon Musk.
Wh, what are you doing here?
Oh, man. I, what an honour to meet you. I’m, I’m such a fan of Tesla and SpaceX. All your companies. Howard Wolowitz, Caltech.

Oh, yeah. Nothing better than helping people. Which is something I realized when I was viewing Earth from the deck of the International Space Station, where I spent two months as a payload specialist, a job I was qualified for because I’m an MIT-trained engineer.
Sorry. It’s just, you’re you, you know? And I really want you to adopt me.
Oh. I made my wife come down, too.
Is that a job offer? ‘Cause I really want to go to Mars. Assuming I can bring my wife. She hardly takes up any room. She’s basically a carry-on.
Thank you.
A partially eaten piece of pumpkin pie from a homeless shelter? With Elon Musk, you bet I do.
Siri: Here are some images of naked grandma butts.
Sheldon: Hey. Good news, everybody. Now that I’m no longer with Amy, I have an extra ticket to the annual Thanksgiving lunch buffet at the aquarium cafeteria. Who wants it? Well, you realize you won’t be going alone, I’ll be there the whole time. Providing fish and pilgrim facts. Can you people hear me?
Well, Howard, what about you?
Well, I’m calling because Thanksgiving is coming up, and I wanted to offer you the aquarium tickets.
No. They’d rather spend the holiday with each other than find out of this is the year I finally touch a starfish. Anyway, I wouldn’t want the tickets to go to waste, so take whomever you’d like.
And feel free to tell your guest that the Myanmar catfish is also known as the pilgrim fish. In case the turkey’s dry and you need something juicy.
You don’t think that will be awkward?
Very well, then. I’ll see you on Thanksgiving morning.
Oh, and forget what I said about the Myanmar catfish. My list of marine-themed pilgrim facts is pretty short.
And there goes my list.
Hello.
I am. You know, and in an effort to reduce awkwardness as we learn how to function as friends, I printed out a list of safe topics for polite conversation.
If there were a list of things that make me more comfortable, lists would be on the top of that list. Okay, now, oh, since last we spoke, have you acquired any pets?
No. Um, since last we spoke, have you planned or gone on any vacations?
Mm. Your aunt in Modesto?
Bakersfield. I see. Where has this list been all my life?
and then the next day was 73 degrees, and the day after that was 72, and then it was 72 again, uh, then it was 74, and that brings us to today, at I’d wear shorts if I had a pair. 78.
I don’t know if I’d call it discussing. You kind of sat back and let me do all the work. Let’s see, what’s next on the list. Oh, uh, do you whittle, and if so, what kind of knife do you use.
All right. Well, what should we talk about?
Very well. I know you’ve been seeing other men. Have you had coitus with any of them?
I’m sensing things have gotten awkward.
All right.
Just a few.
How many dates have you been on? Who were they with? Where’d you go? Where did you meet them? Did you sleep with them? And how much longer to the aquarium? I’m getting kind of hungry.
Is that regular or honey nut?
You mixed them. No wonder gentleman callers are pounding down your door. Do you have any questions for me?
I am.
I believe you. I’d believe you more if you threw a few Apple Jacks in here.
You know, for a Thanksgiving buffet in an aquarium cafeteria, that was really bad.
They gave one to that baby. He wasn’t even awake.
Oh. Would you care to play an ocean-themed game I invented?
It’s called Food, Friend, Fight. One of us chooses three aquatic creatures, and the other one must decide which he would eat, befriend, or battle.
What is that?
Well, my game is better, ’cause instead of marrying someone, you get to eat them.
I’ll start you off easy. Electric eel, pufferfish, shrimp.
Very well done.
Well, I’d befriend SpongeBob but he’s not real, so I can’t do that, can I?

Hey, let’s not pull at that thread. Okay. I’ll fight SpongeBob, because he’s so friendly we’ll just end up tickling each other. Um, I’ll befriend the seal, because he’s trainable, which is the problem I’m having with my current friends. Which means I’ll have to eat the hagfish.
I know. It makes its own gravy, it’ll slide right down.
How can you miss a game you’ve never played before, silly?
Me, too. It’s comforting to know that she and I are able to function as friends.
Oh, I’m sure you and Leonard will be able to pull it off. (Phone rings) Oh. It’s my friend Amy. Hello.
Did you have a nice time?
Well, I can’t take all the credit. It was pretty funny when that one anchovy started going the wrong way.
Oh. I thought we were just friends.
Amy, I excel at many things, but getting over you wasn’t one of them. I think I need to just be your friend.
Good. Oh, I watched a video of the hagfish producing mucus, so I’m gonna change my answer and eat SpongeBob.
Leonard: Well, we’re having everyone over.
Otherwise we’d love to.
Yeah, poor us.
I know. I feel so grown up.
Really? How many grown-ups do you know who have Mr. Spock oven mitts? Hey, the recipes are on my iPad. Will you pull ’em up?
My birthday.
It’s just the four digits, month and day.
Let me see. Yeah, there. What number were you putting in?
You don’t know my birthday, do you?
Well, what is it?
May what?
You don’t know your own husband’s birthday.
Your birthday is December 2, you grew up on Perkins Street, the last four digits of your social are 7 6-2 1, and the odds of me letting you forget this are zero.
Next we need a teaspoon of pepper, which, I believe, was also the name of your childhood dog.
Baby.
Justin.
Nice try. NSYNC forever.
Face it, you can’t stump me. I am the king of husbands. I know that you don’t like the lingerie that I got you on Valentine’s Day. I know you hate the word moist. I know…
Because it’s orange and you think it makes you look like a slutty carrot.
Sure you did.
What? I didn’t know you had a journal.
No, it doesn’t.
Come on, don’t be mad. It was a long time ago, and it was an accident.
I didn’t even know what it was. I saw it on your nightstand. I picked it up.
You know me, I’m a big ol’ bookworm.
Well, hey, okay. Let me make this up to you. Sometimes I keep an online journal. I want you to read something that I wrote.
Okay. Well, then I’ll read it to you. It’s from the day we first met. Beauty, thy name is Penny.
Fine. Mmm, Penny’s beauty, like our love, grows more with each passing day.”
Why would I lie?
Well, you didn’t read it right. The new Star Wars is coming. Gah.
Be right there. Hi, lover.
I’m sorry about the journal. I want to make it up to you. So I’m gonna let you post a shame photo of me on Facebook.
Don’t want people to see what, huh? A little bit of this?
Huh? Some of this? And, since it’s Thanksgiving, an extra helping of this?
I’m glad you had a nice time with Amy.
Penny: Yeah, Leonard and I are gonna be cooking all day.
But we can’t.
Mm-hmm.
Look at us. Our first Thanksgiving as husband and wife.
Sweetie, you are grown up.
Yep. What’s the code?
It’s not working.
Nope.
Uh.
Yes, I do.
May.
I’m not gonna say your password out loud. That is not secure.
Well, you don’t know everything about me.
Oh, look at us. Our last Thanksgiving as husband and wife.
Fine. You think you know so much. Who’s my favourite Spice Girl?
Who’s my favorite member of NSYNC?
Who’s my favorite Backstreet Boy?
Damn it.
Hang on. Wait, wait. Why don’t I like the lingerie you got me?
Interesting. I never told you that.
No. I never told anyone that. But I did write it in my journal.
I also know your voice gets higher when you’re lying.
How can reading my journal be an accident?
Well, when you realized what it was, why didn’t you stop?
All right. Let’s just finish cooking.
Okay, really, I’m fine.
Oh, God. Stop. I don’t want you to read something you think’ll just butter me up. I want to hear the most recent thing you wrote.
Does it really say that?
OMG. OMG. We’re so close to the new Star Wars. I can’t take it. Gah. Gah?
Hey. Where’d you go? I can’t tell if the turkey’s done.
What are you doing?
I am not putting that on the Internet. I don’t want people to see this. I don’t want to see it.
Oh.
Well, I’ve never been friends with any of my exes.
Bernadette: And Raj and I are volunteering at the soup kitchen, feeding food to the homeless.
You said that sounded like the worst thing ever.
The soup kitchen manager assigns the jobs, and the shifts are six hours.
We are, and I believe the word you’re looking for is yu-huh-huh-huh.
Oh. Okay. Wipe that smug smile off your face.
That he’s an ass? He beat you to it.
Oh, great. We’d love to help.
Amy: No one can go with you?
Oh. Okay. Thank you.
Sheldon, I can tell you want to go, so if you’d be comfortable with it, maybe we could go as friends.
Well it is Thanksgiving in an aquarium cafeteria, so I’m gonna go out on a limb here and say yes. But if you mean between us, I think it’ll be fine.
See you then.
Did you know they served shellfish and eel at the very first Thanksgiving?
Hi. Ready for the aquarium?
If that makes you more comfortable.
No. You?
I might go visit my aunt next week.
No, the one in Bakersfield.
Are we done discussing the weather?
Sheldon. We’ve known each other a long time. We are perfectly capable of having a conversation without relying on a list off the Internet.
I don’t know. Just ask me whatever comes to mind.
Man, I walked right into that one.
No. It’s okay. If we’re friends, we should be able to talk about anything.
So, you had some questions about me seeing other people.
Go ahead.

Let’s see. I have been on six dates with three different people. It was either for coffee or dinner. One I met at a bookstore and two I met online. I haven’t slept with anyone. The aquarium is 40 minutes away. And there’s a baggie of Cheerios for you in the glove compartment.
I mixed them.
Just one. Are you doing okay?
Good. I want you to be happy.
You’re just upset ’cause they ran out of Pilgrim hats.
Well, it wouldn’t be a holiday without you being mad at a baby.
Sure. What is it?
So it’s like Kiss, Marry, Kill.
It’s a game where you’re given three people and you choose which one you’d kiss, marry, or kill.
Let’s just play.

Hmm. Well, I wouldn’t fight the eel, because I know it can generate enough current to kill a horse. So I’d eat the eel, fight the shrimp, and befriend the pufferfish, because it would be nice to have company on those days I feel bloated.
Thank you. Okay, your turn. Hmm. Seal, hagfish, SpongeBob SquarePants.
But you can pal around with a hagfish?
Isn’t that gross? I mean, a hagfish can produce enough mucus to fill a bucket in a minute.
I miss this.
I guess sometimes I’m silly.
Hi, Sheldon. I’m just driving home from my mother’s.
I did. Um, listen, I really enjoyed spending this morning with you.
It was. Uh, listen, I, I was thinking that, um, maybe I’m ready to be your girlfriend again.
We are. But I was hoping, maybe…
Okay. I understand.
Okay. Sure.
Emily: Are you and I close enough for me to say that’s creepy?
Are you and I close enough for me to say…
Soup Kitchen Manager: Oh, I appreciate you guys coming down, but we already have enough people. Any other day, please, come back.
I was wrong. A large group had to cancel.
We’re gonna have you washing dishes. Uh, aprons and rubber gloves are here, just scrape, wash and stack. If you need me, I’ll be around.
I need three people out front.
Emly: Only five hours and 40 minutes to go.
Elon: I’m washing dishes. Well, I was on the turkey line, but I got demoted for being too generous with the gravy.
Nice to meet you, Howard. Feels great to come down here and help the less fortunate, huh?
And I thought I ladled the gravy on thick.
Well, you’re here on Thanksgiving, so you’re probably a good person.
You think you might ever get back out to space?
Well, we’re not quite there yet, but we’re always looking for engineers. So let me give you my e-mail. We can stay in touch.
Oh, look. Someone hardly touched their pumpkin pie. Want to share it with me?

Fine. Mmm, Penny’s beauty, like our love, grows more with each passing day.”

Let’s see. I have been on six dates with three different people. It was either for coffee or dinner. One I met at a bookstore and two I met online. I haven’t slept with anyone. The aquarium is 40 minutes away. And there’s a baggie of Cheerios for you in the glove compartment.

You mixed them. No wonder gentleman callers are pounding down your door. Do you have any questions for me?
Just one. Are you doing okay?
Good. I want you to be happy.
I believe you. I’d believe you more if you threw a few Apple Jacks in here.
Thanks. You got to be kidding me.
Wh, what are you doing here?
I’m washing dishes. Well, I was on the turkey line, but I got demoted for being too generous with the gravy.
Oh, man. I, what an honour to meet you. I’m, I’m such a fan of Tesla and SpaceX. All your companies. Howard Wolowitz, Caltech.
Nice to meet you, Howard. Feels great to come down here and help the less fortunate, huh?

Oh, yeah. Nothing better than helping people. Which is something I realized when I was viewing Earth from the deck of the International Space Station, where I spent two months as a payload specialist, a job I was qualified for because I’m an MIT-trained engineer.
And I thought I ladled the gravy on thick.
Sorry. It’s just, you’re you, you know? And I really want you to adopt me.
Well, you’re here on Thanksgiving, so you’re probably a good person.
Oh. I made my wife come down, too.
You think you might ever get back out to space?
Is that a job offer? ‘Cause I really want to go to Mars. Assuming I can bring my wife. She hardly takes up any room. She’s basically a carry-on.
Well, we’re not quite there yet, but we’re always looking for engineers. So let me give you my e-mail. We can stay in touch.
Oh, look. Someone hardly touched their pumpkin pie. Want to share it with me?
A partially eaten piece of pumpkin pie from a homeless shelter? With Elon Musk, you bet I do.
You know, for a Thanksgiving buffet in an aquarium cafeteria, that was really bad.
You’re just upset ’cause they ran out of Pilgrim hats.
They gave one to that baby. He wasn’t even awake.
Well, it wouldn’t be a holiday without you being mad at a baby.
Oh. Would you care to play an ocean-themed game I invented?
It’s called Food, Friend, Fight. One of us chooses three aquatic creatures, and the other one must decide which he would eat, befriend, or battle.
So it’s like Kiss, Marry, Kill.
It’s a game where you’re given three people and you choose which one you’d kiss, marry, or kill.
Well, my game is better, ’cause instead of marrying someone, you get to eat them.
I’ll start you off easy. Electric eel, pufferfish, shrimp.

Hmm. Well, I wouldn’t fight the eel, because I know it can generate enough current to kill a horse. So I’d eat the eel, fight the shrimp, and befriend the pufferfish, because it would be nice to have company on those days I feel bloated.
Thank you. Okay, your turn. Hmm. Seal, hagfish, SpongeBob SquarePants.
Well, I’d befriend SpongeBob but he’s not real, so I can’t do that, can I?
But you can pal around with a hagfish?

Hey, let’s not pull at that thread. Okay. I’ll fight SpongeBob, because he’s so friendly we’ll just end up tickling each other. Um, I’ll befriend the seal, because he’s trainable, which is the problem I’m having with my current friends. Which means I’ll have to eat the hagfish.
Isn’t that gross? I mean, a hagfish can produce enough mucus to fill a bucket in a minute.
I know. It makes its own gravy, it’ll slide right down.
How can you miss a game you’ve never played before, silly?
Hey. Where’d you go? I can’t tell if the turkey’s done.
I’m sorry about the journal. I want to make it up to you. So I’m gonna let you post a shame photo of me on Facebook.
I am not putting that on the Internet. I don’t want people to see this. I don’t want to see it.
Don’t want people to see what, huh? A little bit of this?
Huh? Some of this? And, since it’s Thanksgiving, an extra helping of this?
I’m glad you had a nice time with Amy.
Me, too. It’s comforting to know that she and I are able to function as friends.
Well, I’ve never been friends with any of my exes.
Oh, I’m sure you and Leonard will be able to pull it off. (Phone rings) Oh. It’s my friend Amy. Hello.
Hi, Sheldon. I’m just driving home from my mother’s.
Did you have a nice time?
I did. Um, listen, I really enjoyed spending this morning with you.
Well, I can’t take all the credit. It was pretty funny when that one anchovy started going the wrong way.
It was. Uh, listen, I, I was thinking that, um, maybe I’m ready to be your girlfriend again.
Oh. I thought we were just friends.
We are. But I was hoping, maybe…
Amy, I excel at many things, but getting over you wasn’t one of them. I think I need to just be your friend.
Good. Oh, I watched a video of the hagfish producing mucus, so I’m gonna change my answer and eat SpongeBob.
